item.title: List Monad in JavaScript
item.description: Thoughts I’m writing this more as a way to document and organize my thoughts around the list monad. This is a very important monad. The Code export const List = list => ({ list, map: fn => List(list.map(fn)), fold: (fn, initialValue) => List(list.reduce(fn, initialValue)), foldMap(monoid, empty) { const mappedList = list.reduce(fn, initialValue); const result = mappedList.reduce( (accumalator, monoidValue) => accumalator.concat(monoidValue), empty, ); return List(result); }, extract: () => list, }); Example Here is a sample implementation of this list monad.
